{"step_by_step_thinking": "The prognosis of breast cancer is determined by several factors. However, among the options provided, the most important factor is the tumor stage. The stage of the tumor takes into account the size of the tumor, whether it has spread to the lymph nodes, and whether it has metastasized to other parts of the body. Tumor grade, which refers to how abnormal the cancer cells look under a microscope and how quickly the cancer is likely to grow and spread, is also important but not as crucial as the stage. The patient's age and the location of the tumor on the breast are less significant in determining prognosis.", "answer_choice": "B"}
